title: Strengthening Customer Experience Competencies: Reverse Engineering of Nanophotonic Structures: Deep Learning-Based Material and Shape Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational optics theory, basic materials science, and understanding of programming (Python/TensorFlow/PyTorch) and deep learning models
context.additional_context: Customer service competency enhancement program for service/customer-facing role practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the optical properties of various nanophotonic materials (plasmonic metals, high-refractive-index dielectrics, phase-change materials, 2D materials) and explain material selection criteria based on design conditions.
Learners can quantify optical spectra generated by arbitrary polygonal meta-atom structures using deep learning-based forward models.
Learners can perform inverse design of active metasurfaces with switchable functionalities by combining surrogate modeling and optimization techniques.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
